data.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Bright Look
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hexed Flame
attacks.text: Does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

data.name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

data.name: Claydol

abilities.name: Cosmic Power
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose up to 2 cards from your hand and put them on the bottom of your deck in any order. If you do, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. This power can't be used if Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Draw In
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

data.name: Shuckle

abilities.name: Fresh Squeezed
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Energy Drink
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

abilities.name: Overheat
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Team Magma's Camerupt. Put 2 damage counters on Team Mamga's Camerupt. This power can't be used if Team Magma's Camerupt is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Team Magma's Camerupt to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Armor
abilities.text: If your opponent has 5 of more cards in his or her hand, any damage done to Pinsir by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Delta Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Fiery Aura
abilities.text: As long as Rapidash is your Active Pokémon, put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Palkia

attacks.name: Wormhole
attacks.text: Switch Palkia with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.

data.name: Cinccino

abilities.name: Make Do
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body secrets oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

data.name: Garchomp-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

attacks.name: Lizard Poison
attacks.text: If 1 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If 2 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If 3 Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. If 4 or more Energy is attached to Sceptile, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Burned, and Poisoned.

data.name: Gengar

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.

data.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: All Energy attached to this Pokémon are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

data.name: Meganium

abilities.name: Wild Growth
abilities.text: As long as Meganium is in play each Grass Energy card attached to your Grass Pokémon instead provides GrassGrass. This power stops working while Meganium is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.

data.name: Latias

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Infinite Wind
attacks.text: If Latios is on your Bench, remove 2 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It communicates using telepathy. Its body is covered in down that refracts light to make it invisible.

data.name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Lanturn to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.

data.name: Togepi

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

data.flavorText: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.

data.name: Chimchar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

data.flavorText: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

data.name: Shelmet

attacks.name: Mysterious Evolution
attacks.text: If Karrablast is in play, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

data.name: Snorunt

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

data.name: Team Magma's Baltoy

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: They all cry out at once to let us know when they spot an enemy. It really helps out!

abilities.name: Psy Shadow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to Gardevoir and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bustle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If either coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Talonflame BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Talonflame BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Deoxys ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys ex and switch it with Deoxys ex. (Any cards attached to Deoxys ex, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys ex on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Fastwave
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Beedrill

abilities.name: Flutter Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Needle Shock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Ignore this effect if any of your Pokémon used Needle Shock during your last turn.

data.flavorText: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Dark Tyranitar.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 70 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.name: Omastar

abilities.name: Restoring Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Restored Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.

data.name: Rayquaza δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Metal type.

abilities.name: Hydro Barrier
abilities.text: As long as Rayquaza has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, each of your Water Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Dark Magcargo

abilities.name: Hot Plate
abilities.text: As long as Dark Magcargo is your Active Pokémon, whenever a player puts a Baby Pokémon or Basic Pokémon onto his or her Bench from his or her hand, this power does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working if Dark Magcargo is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Ball of Flame
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy card attached to Dark Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The shell on its back comes off easily, exposing the flames running through its body.

data.name: Illumise

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Twirling Sign
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Smoke Bomb
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Flame Drum
attacks.text: If Magby isn't anywhere under Magmortar, discard 2 Energy cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 Energy cards from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

data.flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

data.name: Entei-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Brave Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Milotic

abilities.name: Energy Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, attach 3 basic Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX).

data.flavorText: Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.

data.name: Venomoth-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shinobi Mastery
attacks.text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ten-Card Return-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Vileplume δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Psychic Metal type.

abilities.name: Poison Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's hand.

abilities.name: Lazy
abilities.text: As long as Slaking is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Critical Move
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card attached to Slaking or this attack does nothing. Slaking can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Misty
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.

data.name: Furret

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.

data.name: Gogoat

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It can tell how its trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathetic sense lets them run as if one being.

data.name: Oranguru

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

data.name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Sketch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacked last turn, and Smeargle was in play during that attack, Smeargle copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack.

data.flavorText: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

data.name: Chimchar

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Heatran

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Boiling Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

data.name: Rayquaza

attacks.name: Inferno Spear
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza.

data.flavorText: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

data.name: Frogadier

abilities.name: Gale Shuriken
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos or this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

data.name: Computer Error
rules: You may draw up to 5 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 5 cards. Your turn is over now (you don't get to attack).

data.name: Ho-Oh ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Golden Wing
abilities.text: If Ho-Oh ex would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move up to 2 Energy attached to Ho-Oh ex to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Ho-Oh ex.

data.name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Darkness Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts as evolving Azurill) and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Type Match
attacks.text: Choose a basic Energy card in your hand and show it to your opponent. Then, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card of that Energy type, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

data.name: Team Magma's Claydol

abilities.name: Magma Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your Team Magma Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Claydol's beam can seize opponents and keep them from moving. Long-range attacks are its specialty!

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

data.name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Steenee

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Heavy Suplex
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It swings its long antlers wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.

abilities.name: Primal Stare
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from his or her hand to evolve his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Luring Antenna
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Glalie

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Salamence is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Flame
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Salamence. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Accelgor

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Berserker Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

abilities.name: Crust
abilities.text: Any damage done to Pinsir by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Metal Trait
abilities.text: As long as Bastiodon has a Pokémon Tool attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon between turns.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Bastiodon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: Bastiodon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Torracat

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

data.name: Orbeetle

abilities.name: Bug's Radar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Brainwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

data.name: Whimsicott

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can only use that attack.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.

data.name: Shuckle-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Protective Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have 2 or fewer Energy attached to them.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Wrap-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Lie Low
attacks.text: All damage done to Brock's Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthdrill
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Brock's Dugtrio used its Lie Low attack last turn.

data.name: Alolan Marowak

attacks.name: Dance of Flames
attacks.text: For each Energy attached to your opponent's Pokémon, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Burning Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads. If either of them is heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Multi Bubble
attacks.text: If Vaporeon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Spewpa

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

data.name: Gossifleur

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Zorua

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

data.name: Latios

abilities.name: Luster Float
abilities.text: If you have Latias in play, the Retreat Cost for Latios is 0.

attacks.name: Infinite Wing
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Latios.

data.flavorText: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokémon that dislikes fighting.

data.name: Dartrix
data.flavorText: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

data.name: Glalie

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move a Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can't help but grovel before it.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

data.name: Shiftry-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Den of Iniquity-GX
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

attacks.name: Bursting Hand
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards there.

attacks.name: Shuffle Attack
attacks.text: Look at a number of cards on top of your opponent's deck equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. Put those cards in any order, and then put them back on top of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Alolan Sandshrew

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Purifying Flame
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fusion Flare
attacks.text: If Zekrom is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

data.name: Dartrix

attacks.name: Wing Flick
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

abilities.name: Cursed Glare
abilities.text: As long as Dusclops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards (except for Darkness and Metal Energy cards) from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Shield
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dusclops by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Accelgor

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Shelmet during this turn, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

data.flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Find Ice
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Chandelure

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Inferno
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

data.name: Elekid

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Elekid is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Elekid by attacks.

attacks.name: Sparking Ball
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Elekid is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Even in the most vicious storm, this Pokémon plays happily if thunder rumbles in the sky.

data.name: Crustle

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 80 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.flavorText: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

data.name: Pignite

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

data.name: Entei

abilities.name: Legendary Body
abilities.text: As long as Entei is your Active Pokémon, Entei and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Entei. (This power works even if Entei is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

attacks.name: Mega Flame
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Fire Energy card from Entei, if it has any.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land. It is said that one is born every time a new volcano appears.

abilities.name: Bedhead
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax remains Asleep between turns, put 2 damage counters on 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Dozing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, you may remove 2 damage counters from Snorlax and Snorlax is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Beautifly

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Beautifly the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

data.name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

attacks.name: Hand Refresh
attacks.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws up to 4 cards. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Reactive Recharge
abilities.text: If Magneton would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move any number of React Energy cards from Magneton to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Multiple Force
attacks.text: If Magneton has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Magnemite and Magneton (both yours and your opponent's) in play.

data.name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Pichu
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon in play that has a Pokémon Power. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.flavorText: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.

data.name: Litleo

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

data.name: Lucario

attacks.name: Bulk Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of Lucario's attacks does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras, even foes it could not otherwise see.

data.name: Shaymin

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Bearing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all attached cards and puts them on the bottom of their deck.

data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

data.name: Dragalge

abilities.name: Poison Barrier
abilities.text: Your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Ghastly Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Finger Poke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Frogadier

attacks.name: Aqua Wave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Vaporeon but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

data.flavorText: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin that is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

data.name: Dark Omastar

attacks.name: Prehistoric Water
attacks.text: If your opponent has any evolved Pokémon in play, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, your opponent takes the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Dark Tentacle
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't evolve except from effects of attacks or Pokémon Powers. (Benching that Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: Nothing can escape once wrapped in its tentacles, which it uses for self-defense as well as to catch food.

data.name: Trevenant-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Forest
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wood Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Finneon
data.flavorText: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

data.name: Metagross

abilities.name: Magnetic Reversal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Metagross's Extra Comet Punch attack's base damage is 100.

data.flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discard the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Fire Stream
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo in order to use this attack. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Banette

attacks.name: Ghost Head
attacks.text: Put as many damage counters as you like on Banette. (You can't put more than Banette's remaining HP.) Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiteful Pain
attacks.text: If Banette is in your discard pile, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage, then search your discard pile for Banette, show it to your opponent, and shuffle it into your deck.

data.flavorText: A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from being junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.

data.name: Omastar BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Omastar BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

abilities.name: Dangerous Tentacle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX with his or her Active Pokémon.

data.name: Infernape

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attack. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Malevolent Fire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hand and feet. It will take on any opponent.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Exploud

attacks.name: Ambient Noise
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If the first coin is heads, this attack does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If the first coin is tails, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If the second coin is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If the second coin is tails, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

data.name: Glaceon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crystal Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

data.name: Froslass

abilities.name: Cursed Glare
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

attacks.name: Earth Rift
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, flip a coin. If tails, this attack can't be used during your next turn.

attacks.name: Iron Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. If 1 is heads and 1 is tails, this attack just does 50 damage.

abilities.name: Delta Sign
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Delta Sign Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Fearow is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Holon's Electrode
rules: You may attach this as an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon that already has an Energy card attached to it. When you attach this card, return an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Numel

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

data.name: The Rocket's Trap
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose up to 3 cards at random from your opponent's hand (don't look at them). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck.

data.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

data.name: Palkia
rules: Lustrous Orb: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to Water type, Palkia's attacks do 20 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Zone Shift
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pearl Blast
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Palkia to your hand. If you do, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Love Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage if you have at least 1 Giovanni's Nidoking on your Bench. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

data.name: Articuno

ancientTrait.name: Δ Plus
ancientTrait.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Chilling Sigh
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tri Edge
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

data.flavorText: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

data.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

data.name: Rainbow Energy
rules: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy counts as every type of basic Energy but only provides 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

data.name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Earth Power
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Happiny

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.

attacks.name: Lively
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.

attacks.name: Delta Copy
attacks.text: Choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has δ on its card. Delta Copy copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Togetic performs that attack.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

data.name: Fennekin

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

data.name: Petilil

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

data.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and being flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Wooloo

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

data.name: Decidueye

abilities.name: Deep Forest Camo
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

attacks.name: Splitting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye's shots never miss.

attacks.name: Hyper Healing

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

data.name: Lycanroc-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lycanfang-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

data.name: Dark Alakazam

attacks.name: Teleport Blast
attacks.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: Almost as if it were being controlled by something else, it never changes expressions, even in the middle of battle.

data.name: Skiddo

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
